intro: Parathesis subulata, commonly known as the slender featherplant, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a unique subject for ecological and horticultural study.
